department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
short_summary: Health Canada, National Dosimetry Services Division (NDSD) has a requirement for the supply of up to 700 Electronic Personal Dosimeters (EPD) and EPD readers (communications interfaces) with software and licenses;.
description: This procurement is for 700 electronic personal dosimeters to be supplied and delivered. EPDs must meet all mandatory technical requirements described in Annex A. The procurement includes an option to purchase up to 350 additional units between contract award and March 31, 2026, on an as and when requested basis.
full_summary:
Electronic Personal Dosimeters
=============================

Request for Proposal
-------------------

Trade Agreement Options
-----------------------

This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:

*   Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
*   World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
*   Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
*   Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)

Objective
----------

The purpose of this Request for Proposal (RFP) is to acquire Electronic Personal Dosimeters (EPDs) that meet Health Canada's requirements. The EPDs will be used by Health Canada's National Dosimetry Services Division (NDSD) for operational purposes.

Bidding Information
-------------------

*   Solicitation Number: HT 250-214030/C
*   Bid Closing Date: December 8, 2022, 2:00 PM (EST)
*   Expected Contract Start Date: None
*   Expected Contract End Date: None

Technical Requirements
-------------------------

The EPDs must meet the following technical requirements:

*   Calibrated to a level of:
    *   ± 2.5% > 101 keV,
    *   ± 3.0% > 50 keV,
    *   ± 3.5% < 50 keV.
*   Measuring range: 10 mrem to 200 R
*   Measurement accuracy: ≤ ± 10% at any point within the measurement range
*   Calibration interval: every 2 years

How to Bid
------------

*   Interested suppliers can obtain the RFP package from the Government of Canada's procurement website, Canadabuys, at https://buyandsell.gc.ca /
*   Bidders are required to submit a proposal that meets the requirements outlined in the RFP package
*   The selection process will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price

###  **Timeline**

*   The bid closing date is December 8, 2022, at 2:00 PM (EST)
